alert.note: Alert for Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 2:01PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following county, Latah. Portions of Southeast Washington, including the following county, Garfield. * WHEN...From early Monday morning through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Debris flows are possible in steep terrain and near burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - High levels of atmospheric moisture associated with the remnants of Hurricane Hilary are forecast to impact the central and lower ID Panhandle and extreme southeast Washington. Periods of moderate to heavy rainfall are possible Monday and Tuesday, with enhanced rainfall rates due to embedded thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
